==Events==
* [[476]] &ndash; [[Romulus Augustulus]], last emperor of the [[Western Roman Empire]], is deposed when [[Odoacer]] proclaims himself "[[King of Italy]]", thus [[fall of the Roman Empire|ending the Western Roman Empire]].
* [[626]] &ndash; Li Shimin, [[Posthumous name|posthumously]] known as [[Emperor Taizong of Tang]], assumes the [[throne]] over the [[Tang Dynasty]] of China.
*[[1260]] &ndash; The [[Siena|Sienese]] [[Ghibellines]], supported by the forces of King [[Manfred of Sicily]], defeat the [[Florence|Florentine]] [[Guelphs]] at [[battle of Montaperti|Montaperti]].
*[[1479]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Alcáçovas]] is signed by the [[Ferdinand and Isabella|Catholic Monarchs]] of [[Crown of Castile|Castile]] and [[Crown of Aragon|Aragon]] on one side and [[Afonso V of Portugal|Afonso V]] and his son, [[John II of Portugal|Prince John]] of [[Portugal]].
*[[1666]] &ndash; In London, England, the most destructive damage from the [[Great Fire of London|Great Fire]] occurs.
*[[1774]] &ndash; [[New Caledonia]] is first sighted by Europeans, during the second voyage of Captain [[James Cook]].
*[[1781]] &ndash; [[Los Angeles, California]], is founded as [[El Pueblo de Nuestra Señora La Reina de los Ángeles de Porciúncula]] (The Village of Our Lady, the Queen of the Angels of [[Porziuncola]]) by 44 Spanish settlers.
*[[1797]] &ndash; [[Coup of 18 Fructidor]] in France.
*[[1800]] &ndash; The French garrison in [[Valletta]] surrenders to British troops who had been called at the invitation of the [[Maltese people|Maltese]]. The islands of [[Malta Island|Malta]] and [[Gozo]] become the [[Malta Protectorate]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: The [[Siege of Fort Harrison]] begins when the fort is set on fire.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]] [[Maryland Campaign]]: General [[Robert E. Lee]] takes the Army of Northern Virginia, and the war, into the North.
*[[1870]] &ndash; Emperor [[Napoleon III of France]] is deposed and the [[French Third Republic|Third Republic]] is declared.
*[[1882]] &ndash; [[Thomas Edison]] flips the switch to the first commercial electrical power plant in history, lighting one square mile of [[lower Manhattan]]. This is considered by many as the day that began the electrical age.
*[[1886]] &ndash; [[American Indian Wars]]: after almost 30 years of fighting, [[Apache Tribe|Apache]] leader [[Geronimo]], with his remaining warriors,  surrenders to General [[Nelson Miles]] in [[Arizona]].
*[[1888]] &ndash; [[George Eastman]] registers the trademark ''[[Kodak]]'' and receives a patent for his [[camera]] that uses roll film.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Albania]]n rebels succeed in [[Albanian Revolt of 1912|their revolt]] when the Ottoman Empire agrees to fulfill their demands
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Mustafa Kemal Atatürk]], who founded the Republic of [[Turkey]], gathers a congress in [[Sivas Congress|Sivas]] to make decisions as to the future of [[Anatolia]] and [[Thrace]].
*[[1923]] &ndash; Maiden flight of the first U.S. [[airship]], the {{USS|Shenandoah|ZR-1|6}}.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: a [[Bristol Blenheim]] is the first British aircraft to cross the German coast following the declaration of war and German ships are bombed.
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: a German submarine makes the first attack against a United States ship, the {{USS|Greer|DD-145|6}}.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: the British [[11th Armoured Division]] liberates the Belgian city of [[Antwerp]].
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: [[Finland]] exits from the [[Continuation War|war with Soviet Union]]. 
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Wilhelmina of the Netherlands|Queen Wilhelmina of the Netherlands]] abdicates for health reasons.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[Peekskill Riots]] erupt after a [[Paul Robeson]] concert in [[Peekskill, New York]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Darlington Raceway]] is the site of the inaugural [[Southern 500 (1950–2004)|Southern 500]], the first 500-mile [[NASCAR]] race.
*[[1951]] &ndash; The first live transcontinental [[television]] broadcast takes place in [[San Francisco, California]], from the [[Japanese Peace Treaty Conference]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[African-American Civil Rights Movement (1955-1968)|American Civil Rights Movement]]: [[Little Rock Crisis]] &ndash; [[Orval Faubus]], [[governor of Arkansas]], calls out the [[Arkansas National Guard|National Guard]] to prevent African American students from enrolling in [[Little Rock Central High School|Central High School]].
*  1957   &ndash; The [[Ford Motor Company]] introduces the [[Edsel]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Swissair Flight 306]] crashes near [[Dürrenäsch]], Switzerland, killing all 80 people on board.
*[[1964]] &ndash; Scotland's [[Forth Road Bridge]] near [[Edinburgh]] officially opens.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[Operation Swift]] begins: U.S. [[United States Marines|Marine]]s engage the [[North Vietnam]]ese in battle in the [[Khe Sanh|Que Son Valley]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Salvador Allende]] is elected President of [[Chile]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Alaska Airlines Flight 1866]] crashes near [[Juneau, Alaska]], killing all 111 people on board.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Mark Spitz]] becomes the first competitor to win seven medals at a single [[Olympic Games]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Sinai Interim Agreement]] relating to the [[Arab-Israeli conflict]] is signed.
*[[1977]] &ndash; The [[Golden Dragon Massacre]] took place in [[San Francisco, California]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; The discovery of [[Buckminsterfullerene]], the first [[fullerene]] molecule of carbon.
*[[1989]] &ndash; In [[Leipzig]], [[East Germany]], the first of [[Monday demonstrations in East Germany|weekly demonstration]] for the legalisation of opposition groups and [[democracy|democratic]] reforms takes place.
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[War on Drugs]]: [[Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia]] (FARC) attack a military base in [[Guaviare Department|Guaviare]], starting three weeks of [[guerrilla warfare]] in which at least 130 [[Colombia]]ns are killed.
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Google]] is founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]], two students at [[Stanford University]].
<!--Don't list Steve Irwin's (or any other) death here &ndash; the events section is not for deaths. Instead, see the "Deaths" section below, where his death is already mentioned. -->
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Tokyo DisneySea]] opens to the public as part of the [[Tokyo Disney Resort]] in [[Urayasu]], [[Chiba Prefecture|Chiba]], [[Japan]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; Three terrorists suspected to be a part of [[Al-Qaeda]] are arrested in Germany after [[2007 bomb plot in Germany|allegedly planning attacks]] on both the Frankfurt International airport and US military installations.
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[2010 Canterbury earthquake|Canterbury earthquake]]: a 7.1 magnitude earthquake which struck the South Island of New Zealand at 4:35 am causing widespread damage and several power outages.
